meanings.definition: To deviate from a straight course
meanings.sent1: The boat yawed off course due to strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The car yawed slightly as the driver tried to avoid a pothole.
meanings.sent3: The kite yawed playfully in the gusty wind, making it hard to control.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts yawed from one worry to another, unable to focus.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle yawed wildly, unable to settle on a direction.

meanings.definition: Turned or swung to one side
meanings.sent1: The yawed tree leaned precariously after the storm.
meanings.sent2: His yawed posture indicated discomfort or pain.
meanings.sent3: The yawed picture frame hung crookedly on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The yawed door creaked as it swung open slowly.
meanings.sent5: The yawed horizon made the landscape look uneven and surreal.

meanings.sent1: The drunk man yawed as he tried to walk in a straight line.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird yawed in its attempt to fly away.
meanings.sent3: The old ship yawed in the rough sea, making the crew dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candle flame yawed in the drafty room.
meanings.sent5: The toddler yawed unsteadily on the wobbly chair, almost falling off.
